Posts.Content: Kozmic got a referral from my Urologist, his nurses made contact and the Physical Therapy receptionist contacted me. Thanks Steve, Glad I decided to seek help with a professional Therapist. Since my 1st session I've adjusted my urinating pattern, spacing out amount of time in between voids. Instead of going frequently, try to avoid emptying small amounts. So 3 to 4hr period between urinating, I read a post on here about this. Kegel exercises instructions were exactly what was instructed by Urologist. Contractions of 5sec. with 5sec. rest periods 10x 3x a day, Quick contractions 2sec. 10x 3x a day Office kegel exercises consist of inserting a probe which is hooked up to a computer where the contractions intensity is measured . My physical therapist does explain before the insertion of the device but she clearly caught me off guard wasn't expecting this, my Medical Insurance doesn't cover the cost of $47 for the stimulation probe sensor, told the wife now I own my very first butt probe lol, man what next. Well at least my Insurance pays for 6 sessions

Posts.Title: Physical Therapy for incontinence

Posts.Content: JJ Jackson, roblee, PT receptionist asked if I could report in few minutes early to fill out some personal information, a permission authorisation form of insertions needed to be signed. Of course I questioned it, being confused and thinking why would they need to give me a digital rectal exsam? So I approached the secretary and told her, look the only person doing any inserting is my Urologist. Okay Mr.Mahoney I'll have the Therapist explain this latter. lol word of advice do your homework before you going to PT. Therapist and I died laughing in the exam room. Research is helpful people.

Posts.Title: Hello, new guy here, long road ahead......

Posts.Content: 2012 psa 4.0 enlarged prostate, 2016 psa 14.0 prostate enlarged One week ago, I had a prostate biopsy Results to biopsy, positive to cancer, stage 2, gl.6, This Friday scheduleduring for CT bone scan I will keep all posted.
Posts.Title: Hello, new guy here, long road ahead......

Posts.Content: Thank you to everyone, first of all this forum communication is all so new to myself, yes I will set up my personal medical info signature, I wish I had started my own personal journal from the beginning of this ride of life, now I know my Father has written journals of his many health issues, and yes our good friend Mr.Prostate. My Dad had prostate cancer back in the day, sorry don't know the date, my Dad and I have the same Urologist, my Dad has a hard time remembering of all his prostate procedures due to memory loss, he helps me with whatever he can remember if I have questions. I'll try to jump in on here has much as I need to, you know it does help me release some of stress and just having somewhere to say what's on my mind during this stressful time of my life. JM

Posts.Title: Hello, new guy here, long road ahead......

Posts.Content: 8/31, what coincidence, my anxiety was certainly high that day, I mentioned to my wife that day how nervous I was, and Passed Friday I had to take a pain pill before my catheter removal, lol I've had other operations, appendix, gallbladder removal, this one is the real deal. Hey, thanks for the invite to join the three Caballero, but no thanks you guys, I surely appreciate this forum site .

Posts.Title: Getting ready for the Knockdown....

Posts.Content: Hey Max, After Surgery most pain I had came from my back, due to the awkward position I was in for 3 1/2 hrs. , had morphine dripping through my iv throughout the night. Slept like a baby. Morning came, switched over to a pill as needed. Also sent home with pills, used one on catheter removal day ,never needed the rest. They always made me nauseous. If you have a problem with pain, and are experiencing pain by all means let the Medical Physician know about it. Good Luck Max.

Posts.Title: 2 months after DaVinci, back on Foley catheter again

Posts.Content: Roblee, Even though I have Family living in Florida , I'm unfamiliar with any urologist groups there. I've had three Urologist where I live, last two belonged a fine group of Doctors. Each one specialized in performing a specific cancer treatment. My last Urologist I had for over four years is specialized in Radiation Treatment. Sorry I'm no help, but again I wish you the best of luck.
